abstract.p: Paintings made of colored pasta by Mimi Oka and Doug Fitch go on view at Ethan Cohen Fine Arts; photo (S)

block.p: YOU could hang this artwork over your sofa, or eat it. It is among the 4-by-6-foot ''paintings'' made of colored pasta by Mimi Oka and Doug Fitch that go on view at Ethan Cohen Fine Arts, 37 Walker Street (Church Street) on May 24. That evening, they will be sold, cooked by Daniel Boulud and served at Orphic Feast, to benefit the Asia Society. (Other pasta paintings will be shown for two weeks.) Participants can help walk a 250-foot noodle the five blocks from the gallery to a loft on Jay Street for dinner. The paintings can also be preserved for hanging. For information: (212) 327-9235. Benefit tickets are $300.
